Show / Hide Table of Contents

    Class AnimationState

    Applies animations over time, queues animations for later playback, mixes (crossfading) between animations, and applies multiple animations on top of each other (layering).

    See Applying Animations in the Spine Runtimes Guide.

    Inheritance

    TimeScale

    Multiplier for the delta time when the animation state is updated, causing time for all animations and mixes to play slower or faster. Defaults to 1.

    See TrackEntry TimeScale for affecting a single animation.

    Declaration
    public float TimeScale { get; set; }
    Property Value
    Type Description
    Single

    AddAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean, Single)

    Adds an animation to be played after the current or last queued animation for a track. If the track is empty, it is equivalent to calling SetAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean).

    Declaration
    public TrackEntry AddAnimation(int trackIndex, Animation animation, bool loop, float delay)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Int32 trackIndex
    Animation animation
    Boolean loop
    Single delay

    If > 0, sets Delay. If <= 0, the delay set is the duration of the previous track entry minus any mix duration (from the {@link AnimationStateData}) plus the specified 

    Delay
    (ie the mix ends at (
    Delay
    = 0) or before (
    Delay
    < 0) the previous track entry duration). If the previous entry is looping, its next loop completion is used instead of its duration.
    Returns
    Type Description
    TrackEntry

    A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs.

    AddEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single, Single)

    Adds an empty animation to be played after the current or last queued animation for a track, and sets the track entry's MixDuration. If the track is empty, it is equivalent to calling SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single).

    Declaration
    public TrackEntry AddEmptyAnimation(int trackIndex, float mixDuration, float delay)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Int32 trackIndex

    Track number.
    Single mixDuration

    Mix duration.
    Single delay

    If > 0, sets Delay. If <= 0, the delay set is the duration of the previous track entry minus any mix duration plus the specified 

    Delay
    (ie the mix ends at (
    Delay
    = 0) or before (
    Delay
    < 0) the previous track entry duration). If the previous entry is looping, its next loop completion is used instead of its duration.
    Returns
    Type Description
    TrackEntry

    A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs.
    See Also

    Apply(Skeleton)

    Poses the skeleton using the track entry animations. There are no side effects other than invoking listeners, so the animation state can be applied to multiple skeletons to pose them identically.

    Declaration
    public bool Apply(Skeleton skeleton)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Skeleton skeleton
    Returns
    Type Description
    Boolean

    True if any animations were applied.
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    ClearTrack(Int32)

    Removes all animations from the track, leaving skeletons in their current pose.

    It may be desired to use SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single) to mix the skeletons back to the setup pose, rather than leaving them in their current pose.

    Declaration
    public void ClearTrack(int trackIndex)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Int32 trackIndex
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    ClearTracks()

    Removes all animations from all tracks, leaving skeletons in their current pose.

    It may be desired to use SetEmptyAnimations(Single) to mix the skeletons back to the setup pose, rather than leaving them in their current pose.

    Declaration
    public void ClearTracks()

    SetAnimation(Int32, Animation, Boolean)

    Sets the current animation for a track, discarding any queued animations. If the formerly current track entry was never applied to a skeleton, it is replaced (not mixed from).

    Declaration
    public TrackEntry SetAnimation(int trackIndex, Animation animation, bool loop)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Int32 trackIndex
    Animation animation
    Boolean loop

    If true, the animation will repeat. If false it will not, instead its last frame is applied if played beyond its duration. In either caseTrackEnd determines when the track is cleared.
    Returns
    Type Description
    TrackEntry

    A track entry to allow further customization of animation playback. References to the track entry must not be kept after the Dispose event occurs.
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single)

    Sets an empty animation for a track, discarding any queued animations, and sets the track entry's . An empty animation has no timelines and serves as a placeholder for mixing in or out.

    Mixing out is done by setting an empty animation with a mix duration using either SetEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single), SetEmptyAnimations(Single), or AddEmptyAnimation(Int32, Single, Single). Mixing to an empty animation causes the previous animation to be applied less and less over the mix duration. Properties keyed in the previous animation transition to the value from lower tracks or to the setup pose value if no lower tracks key the property. A mix duration of 0 still mixes out over one frame.

    Mixing in is done by first setting an empty animation, then adding an animation using and on the returned track entry, set the . Mixing from an empty animation causes the new animation to be applied more and more over the mix duration. Properties keyed in the new animation transition from the value from lower tracks or from the setup pose value if no lower tracks key the property to the value keyed in the new animation.

    Declaration
    public TrackEntry SetEmptyAnimation(int trackIndex, float mixDuration)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Int32 trackIndex
    Single mixDuration
    Returns
    Type Description
    TrackEntry
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    SetEmptyAnimations(Single)

    Sets an empty animation for every track, discarding any queued animations, and mixes to it over the specified mix duration.

    Declaration
    public void SetEmptyAnimations(float mixDuration)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Single mixDuration
